author: Ian Livingston
title: PM Update: Somewhat cooler Wednesday, but lots of sun is likely
description: The blossoms are set to keep on blooming.

author: Paul Waldman, Greg Sargent
title: Suddenly, both parties want to send cash to every American. It might happen.
description: A liberal idea is becoming the new consensus.
content:
At least seven Democratic Senators now support this idea. Those senators have signed a new letter to the Senate leaders in both parties calling on them to support sending up to $4,500 to every adult and child in the United States, in installments.
We propose… [+5196 chars]

author: Lisa Rein
title: Federal personnel chief quits abruptly in the midst of coronarivus planning for the workforce of 2.1 million
description: Dale Cabaniss served as director of the Office of Personnel Management for just five months. She felt undermined by the White House and her agency was sidelined during coronavirus planning.
content:
An agency spokesperson said in a statement that Cabanisss deputy, Michael Rigas, would take over the agency on an acting basis.

author: David Biller and Diarlei Rodrigues | AP
title: Rio's Christ statue closes and state of emergency decreed
description: Rio de Janeiro's Christ the Redeemer statue closed to the public at day-end Tuesday and will remain closed for at least a week to contain the spread of the new coronavirus
content:
At the foot of the statue throughout the overcast afternoon, the last selfie-snapping tourists were still allowed to gather on the lookout that offers a panoramic view out over the so-called Marvelous City.

author: Rachel Siegel
title: U.S. economy expected to lose 4.6 million travel-related jobs this year from coronavirus fallout
description: Total spending on travel in the U.S. is expected to drop by $355 billion for the year, or 31 percent — more than six times the impact of the Sept. 11, 2001, terrorist attacks.
